topics.body:
Squiggybomb,
For a while now, I've been curious about something. And considering the nature of this particular topic that I'm curious about, I figured you'd be the best person to ask about it. Anyway, here's my question:

In your opinion, what made (and continues to make) One Piece so successful? Or to be more specific, what did it do that its competitors Naruto and Bleach failed to do?

I'm well aware of your opinions on all three series, but try to keep your answer as objective as possible.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

topics.body:
Hullo

-7667 reverseesrever getteg-
topics.author: 511c09ec7f123b35980001eb

topics.body:
"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e2c39c6368725c39e60100#post_54e2c39c6368725c39e60100
That is SUPER easy. *FUN.* One Piece may have it's serious moments but Oda never once has lost sight of what it is and what it's about. A group of friends on a big dumb adventure. One Piece is successful because of how much unbridled fun it is to read. And it does this by never once pandering to a specific audience. Naruto fell flat because Kishimoto started to worship Sasuke. Bleach failed because Kubo kept adding characters without developing the ones he had. That made these series less fun to read.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
So I'm getting fired from work because I know too much about things. . . Just fuck everything.


Short version is that cause people kept jacking with the camera even though I told them to stop that they did it anyway and recorded the four hour video all in one segment; well turns out that the internal clock is slightly off on the camera so therefore everything fucked up on it when recording for so long and because my boss can't deal with me being right out the door I go.  His excuse was "you don't know what you're doing"; I knew what I was doing, but you kept fucking with the camera.


Shit like this is why the world's so fucked up because the second a employee understands their job well enough they're out the goddamn door cause "muh feels".

Just fuck everything.

topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e2c4a36368722a1b170e00#post_54e2c4a36368722a1b170e00
Yeah that's what a lot of people say when I asked them about it- their enjoyment of one piece comes from just how much fun it is to read. And I know that it's going to hurt for you to hear me say this, but One piece just never clicked for me. I mentioned this forever ago, but I'll admit that my first exposure to it came from the 4kids dub. After a couple of years I tried again with the new dub, the original Japanese, and then with the manga... But that magical moment when you just absolutely fall in love with the series never came for me.

And I tried. Believe me, I tried my very hardest to like the series. But I couldn't. It just didn't work for me.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3
